body:
I was testing quota and limitrange following [example/resourcequota/README](https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/blob/master/examples/resourcequota/README.md).

First in step 3, there supposed to be a creation failure, but it succeeded. And the resource caculation seems not working for cpu and memory.

```
$ kubectl get pods --namespace=quota-example
NAME          READY     REASON    RESTARTS   AGE
nginx-rxtko   1/1       Running   0          21s

$ kubectl describe namespace quota-example
Name:   quota-example
Labels: <none>
Status: Active

Resource Quotas
 Resource       Used    Hard
 ---            --- ---
 cpu            0   20
 memory         0   1Gi
 persistentvolumeclaims 0   10
 pods           1   10
 replicationcontrollers 1   20
 resourcequotas     1   1
 secrets        0   10
 services       0   5

No resource limits.
```

Second, then I created a different quota to the same namespace. It should not working but worked. The result is as follows:

```
$ kubectl describe quota q --namespace=quota-example
Namespace:      quota-example
Name:           quota1
Resource        Used    Hard
--------        ----    ----
cpu         0   20
memory          0   1Gi
persistentvolumeclaims  0   10
pods            1   10
replicationcontrollers  1   20
resourcequotas      2   1
secrets         0   10
services        0   5

Namespace:      quota-example
Name:           quota2
Resource        Used    Hard
--------        ----    ----
cpu         0   50
memory          0   2Gi
persistentvolumeclaims  0   10
pods            1   10
replicationcontrollers  1   20
resourcequotas      2   1
secrets         0   10
services        0   5
```

But it seems only the first one is taking effect.

```
$ kubectl describe namespace quota-example
Name:   quota-example
Labels: <none>
Status: Active

Resource Quotas
 Resource       Used    Hard
 ---            --- ---
 cpu            0   20
 cpu            0   20
 memory         0   1Gi
 memory         0   1Gi
 persistentvolumeclaims 0   10
 persistentvolumeclaims 0   10
 pods           1   10
 pods           1   10
 replicationcontrollers 1   20
 replicationcontrollers 1   20
 resourcequotas     2   1
 resourcequotas     2   1
 secrets        0   10
 secrets        0   10
 services       0   5
 services       0   5

No resource limits.
```

Also I created more than one limit of same type:

```
Resource Limits
 Type       Resource    Min Max Default
 ----       --------    --- --- ---
 Container  memory      -   -   1Gi
 Container  cpu     -   -   500m
 Container  cpu     -   -   100m
 Container  memory      -   -   512Mi
```

I think we should allow one quota and one limit of same type to apply to a namespace.
